content.question: Two particles, one of charge <math alttext="q sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>q</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math> and one of charge <math alttext="q sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>q</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>, are a distance <math alttext="r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> apart. At this distance, the particles exert electrostatic forces of magnitude <math alttext="F sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> on each other. What is the magnitude of the electrostatic force exerted by two particles that have charges of <math alttext="2 q sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>q</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math> and <math alttext="2 q sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>q</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math> when they are a distance <math alttext="2 r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>r</mi></math> apart?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
